title: Citibank Philippines Redefines Instant Rewards with New Credit Card
summary: The country's largest foreign bank is introducing a new credit card aimed at capturing the growing market keen on instant gratification offers.
tag-1: Citibank Philippines Redefines Instant Rewards with New Credit Card
tag-3: The country's largest foreign bank is introducing a new credit card aimed at capturing the growing market keen on instant gratification offers.
tag-4: The Citibank Rewards Card, the latest addition to Citibank's credit card portfolio, will offer year-round exclusive offers to cardholders with qualified purchases. Three of its benefits that are expected to attract consumers include free movie passes, shopping rebates and annual fee waivers.
tag-5: As Citi marks 200 years as a global company, Consumer Business Manager for Citibank Philippines Sergio Zanatti reaffirmed the bank's commitment to anticipating the needs of consumers and driving innovation for the banking industry.
tag-6: "Since 1990 when we issued the first Citibank credit card in the Philippines, we have been focused on providing world class financial products and services to the Filipino consumer," said Zanatti. "This commitment remains true not only for credit cards but also for personal loans, retail banking and wealth management."
tag-7: Citibank is acknowledged as the country's leading credit card brand, known to more than eight out of every 10 consumers. With nearly a million credit cards in circulation, Citibank also has a dominant share in credit card market sales.
tag-8: With the introduction of the Citibank Rewards Card, Zanatti is confident of a warm welcome from consumers, who are always looking to get the most value out of each spend.
tag-9: In the early 1990s, Citibank pioneered the Rewards program for credit cards, which provides gifts and other incentives to cardholders with every purchase.
tag-10: "Now, as the trend shifts more and more towards instant rewards and the market becomes highly competitive, we are bringing out this new card with one-of-a-kind features that offer not just promotions but rewards you can continuously enjoy throughout the year," said Bea Tan, Credit Payment Products Head.
tag-11: Cardholders get a free P100 movie pass for a minimum single-receipt purchase of P2,500 anywhere, including online and international transactions. They are also entitled to a generous 5 percent rebate whenever they shop at Citibank partner merchants including Aldo, Aldo Accessories, Celio, Charles & Keith, Giordano, Marks & Spencer, Nike Park, Pedro, Runnr, Toby's, Topshop, Topman, Urban Athletics and Zara.
tag-12: The card offers 3 percent rebates at The Landmark Department Store, Metro Department Store, Rustan's Department Store and SM Department Store. It also includes a 1 percent rebate for all other department stores. Cardmembers can use the rebates in denominations of P100 to pay for their next purchase at the participating shops and department stores. And to make sure the rewards never end, these rebates do not expire.
tag-13: The Citibank Rewards Card also waives annual fees for primary cardholders who spend at least P20,000 per month, or P240,000 within their year of membership. Supplementary cardmembers can also enjoy waived fees – the first three get waivers when they each make at least six purchases every membership year.
tag-14: The Citibank Rewards Card is targeted to young professionals who regularly allocate budget for shopping and factor recreation – such as watching movies – into their lifestyle.
tag-15: With the new card, Citibank has made it easier for cardholders to redeem movie passes as they no longer have to collect and present charge slips. The P100 movie passes are credited to their accounts three business days after the purchase and are valid for 30 days.
tag-16: Up to two movie passes can be redeemed per day in participating theaters: Cash & Carry Cinema, Eastwood Cinemas, Festival Cinema, Greenhills Promenade, Greenhills Theatre Mall, Robinsons Movieworld, SM Cinema and Walter Mart Cinemas.
tag-17: "It's shaping up to be another milestone year for Citibank in the Philippines, and we will be sharing more positive news to our loyal clients and to the public in a few months. We want to thank our customers for continuing to support Citibank and are optimistic that they will find our new card to be truly rewarding," said Zanatti.
tag-18: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
